Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: The well - ordered BHJ film morphology of the PffBB-14:PC71BM blend led to superior balanced charge carrier mobility , good exciton dissociation , and the least recombination loss and hence PffBB-14 - based PSC reached the highest photovoltaic performance with a PCE of 9.93% , a V oc of 0.92 V , a J sc of 16.77 mA cm^-2 and , a FF of 64.36% .

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: The well - ordered BHJ film morphology of the PffBB-14:PC71BM blend led to superior balanced charge carrier mobility , good exciton dissociation , and the least recombination loss and hence PffBB-14 - based PSC reached the highest photovoltaic performance with a PCE of 9.93% , a V oc of 0.92 V , a J sc of 16.77 mA cm^-2 and , a FF of 64.36% .

Let's think step by step.

**Property Name**

* balanced charge carrier mobility
* exciton dissociation
* recombination loss
* PCE (Power Conversion Efficiency)
* Voc (Open-Circuit Voltage)
* Jsc (Short-Circuit Current Density)
* FF (Fill Factor)

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

**Property Name**

* balanced charge carrier mobility
* exciton dissociation
* recombination loss
* PCE (Power Conversion Efficiency)
* Voc (Open-Circuit Voltage)
* Jsc (Short-Circuit Current Density)
* Fill Factor (FF)

Note: I have added "Fill Factor" as a material property, assuming that it is a property of the solar cell, as it is commonly used to describe the performance of a solar cell.
